text: Thomas Young (13 June 1773 â€“ 10 May 1829) was an English polymath. Young made important scientific contributions to many fields. His most famous work is on the wave theory of light. He also did good work to the fields of vision, solid mechanics, energy, physiology, language, musical harmony, and Egyptology. Among others, William Herschel, Hermann von Helmholtz, James Clerk Maxwell and Albert Einstein have praised Young's work. ==References== Category:1773 births Category:1829 deaths Category:English writers Category:English archaeologists Category:Quakers Category:British physiologists Category:Fellows of the Royal Society Category:English physicists
title: Thomas Young
